topic.title: Philosophy: Is the Self Right more worth than the Right between two Guys
topic.body:
If two people live in Isolation and they never communicate with each other.
Is here only two rights? The self right of the two people?

And if they communicate and make a peace agreement, is that a creation of right between two People?

And if so. Is the self right more worth than the right between one guy and a other.

For example: If the two guys agree on peace, but its against a agreement that you made with your self in the past, is it than it right to break the agreement with the other guy?

1584235878_19K65385dRL6Z5EPFVEmxpbgJh8CU.body:
> [aassddff](#comment_59_1A8k2FFyono2dUQWKaRzsRvbXguVuXQHYS): You can't make a contract with yourself.

If you say to you in thoughts.
i swear. You speak to yourself. 
Why we should't call that that a agreement.
The reason why we define thinks is the use it of it we take.

A Human is not rational.
Humans have Instincts to.
Platon scripted it as Eros and Thumos.
Eros the sexual and the substantive need.
Thumos the need for pride and recognition.
Logos is the mind.
Every 3 of them have here own needs.
If you think with the Logos you are the Logos.
But if the Eros or Thumos is to strong you can do things that you not want to do.

In such cases I find it useful to make agreements with oneself so that self-warning is strengthened.
